Comment 1: 
One final note:

The implementation performs a bounds check when simply forming a pointer to the address
x[5]:
 
        p := &x[5]  // error: out of bounds
	i, x[i], *p = 1, 100, 500

so if the spec were to prescribe an ordering, the one that results in [1 2 3] seems more
consistent to me.
